captions.text:
Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

Or I probably should say a new Nerdy Nummies!
Because some of you may notice that there’s

something a little bit different about my
kitchen, we have new countertops!

The old countertops were old and busted so
I finally replaced them and I am loving it!

We also built some additional storage space
for all my baking stuff, so, I’m kinda

like, on cloud 9 today! So I apologize in
advance.

I got so many requests from you guys to do
something Big Hero 6 related and I absolutely

love this movie. So today, we are gonna be
making something Baymax, we are gonna be
making Oreo Pop Baymax’s.
Let’s get started!

These Oreo pops are super easy mode, the things
you will need, will be: Mega Stuffed

Oreos, you can also use double stuffed, or
regular, but I thought it would be cute because

Baymax is so fluffy! So the fluffier the better,
I got the mega-fluff!

And then you’re also gonna need some black
decorative icing, and I’ve just put a number

2 tip at the end for more control. And then
to decorate, we’ve got a bunch of M&M’s,

and Mike & Ikes, and then to dip them, we’ve
got red and white candy melts.

The red ones are flavored like vanilla, and
the white ones are flavored like marshmallow!

And last but not least we have some lollipop
sticks.
Alright, let’s put it all together!

The first thing that we’re gonna do is heat
up our candy melts, you can pop these

in the microwave, but I just got this at Michaels,
it’s a candy melting pot, so, I’m

gonna give it a go! Just pour ‘em in here,
doo-doo-doo! And start melting the chocolate!

Now that our candy melts are melted you’re
going to take a lollipop stick and dip just

the tip in there. And then you’re gonna
take an Oreo and place the lollipop stick

in the center, just like so. The candy creates a
little base so that the Oreo will stay up

on your pop! And then you’re gonna do that to the
rest of your Oreos!

Got our Oreo Pops assembled, and now I’m
gonna pop ‘em in the fridge for about 5 minutes

to set and to chill, and while they’re chilling,
we’re gonna cut our Mike & Ike’s in 1/2,

and I’ll show you how to do that.
We’re gonna be doing them the hot dog way,
not the hamburger way!

And, just a reminder, if you’re using 1
of these things, leave it on, because we’re
gonna come back to it in 5 minutes.

To decorate, we are gonna cut a bunch of Mike
& Ike’s in 1/2 and like I said, we are gonna

be cutting them the hotdog, the long way,
not the hamburger way. So, a Mike & Ike like
this,

hotdog way is up and down, vertical, and hamburger
is horizontal.

Here is the base of the Mike & Ike, and here
is the top, and we’re not really gonna cut the

base, but we’re gonna go diagonal up until the
top. And there’s always a little bit extra,
om!
So it’s a treat!

Just took the Oreo pops out of the fridge
and now we are going to dip them into our white

candy melts. Helpful side note, you’ll want
to take a lollipop stick and puncture your holes

before you place your pops in. Otherwise they
shake all around and it gets a little crazy!

So, this 1 has lots of holes, but I’m just
gonna add a few more! Just in case!
Just give it a poke!

Dipping these is super easy. All you have
to do is go straight down, and then tilt

to the side, side, side and side, kind of
like a joystick!

And then slowly pick it up, let the excess
candy drip off, I give it little taps.

And if the back side is a little messy, that’s
OK! We’re not gonna see it!
Baymax only has 1 side of a face…

Then you’re gonna place him in 1 of these
pre-made holes over here.

Now that we have all of our pops dipped, we
are going to attach candies to 1/2 of them
to make armored Baymax!

So for armored Baymax, what you’re gonna
do is you’re gonna take a little pop, and

you’re gonna take a little M&M, and you’re
gonna put a little bit of candy melt on the

M&M, doo-doo-doo-doo-doo! This will act as
a glue.

And now, you’re gonna stick the M&M about
1/2 way, roop! Right in the middle.

And you’re gonna have to hold it there until
the candy dries.  And you're gonna do it to both sides.
And the next step is you’re

gonna take the Mike & Ike that we cut in 1/2,
at a diagonal angle. And again you’re gonna

take your little toothpick, dip it in your
candy melt, put a little bit here on the backside,

and you’re gonna place him right above the
M&M, then you’re gonna do that to the other
side.

Da-dew! Now you’re gonna do this to however
many you want, I’m gonna do 1/2 of them.

We’ve got the candies attached and now
we’re gonna pop these ones, with the candies,

the freezer for about 10 minutes to set, and
then we’re gonna
dip ‘em in some red candy melts. Om-nom-nom-nom-nom-nom!

And the other 1/2, we’re gonna set them
off to the side because we’ll be decorating
their faces soon enough.

Now we’re gonna dip our armored Baymax pops,
which are the ones with the candy on them.

So, over here, we have melted our red candy
melts and they’re ready for dipping.

So I’m just gonna go straight down, and
again to the side, other side, and then straight up.

There we go! Oh, my gosh! And then you’re
gonna let the excess candy drip off in the back.
Look at that, looks just like him!

Now we are gonna decorate the white pops and
we’re gonna let the red pops set for awhile.

So you’re gonna take your little white pop,
dew-dew! The normal Baymax face. I’m just

gonna place it down. And then to decorate his face,
it’s really easy, because he has very

simple facial features. You just need to make
2 dots and connect ‘em.

So I’ve got some black decorative icing
with a number 1 tip.
A-boom! A-Baymax!

Our red Baymax’s have had plenty of time
to harden and now we’re gonna decorate them,

make little faces. So I’m just gonna place
1 down like this, and then I’ve put some

white candy melt into a plastic bag with a
number 2 tip for a little bit more control. And I’m gonna
trace on the opening of his helmet.
And then you’re gonna fill it in, doo-doo-doo-doo-doo-doo-doo!

I’m using a toothpick to connect all of
my white melted candy.

And then I’m gonna do that to all of the
rest of the armored Baymax’s and then draw
the eyeballs like we did before!

Da-da! Here are the Baymax Oreo Pops that
we made today!

Thanks you guys for suggesting something from
Big Hero 6, I love that movie, and these
are adorable! They were so fun to make!

These are a great idea for a little party
favor, they’re just a bit sized yummy!
Om-nom-nom-nom-nom-nom-nom-nom!

I’ll be posting lots of pictures on Facebook,
Tumblr, Instagram and Twitter!

And if you guys make these, please take a
picture and send it to me, I’ll re-blog

it or post it. I just love seeing your baking
creations, I get a big kick out of it,
makes my day!

And, if you have any other ideas for any other Nerdy
Nummies, please let me know,

leave me a comment down below and I will do
my best to make it happen!
Alright, thanks again you guys, bye-bye!
And boop! Ba-da-la-da-la-da-da!

title: BIG HERO 6 BAYMAX OREO POPS - NERDY NUMMIES
